name: places/ChIJdQQQXgdZwokRz4qkG8Ib-5Q
formattedAddress: 200 Madison Ave # 24, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 200 Madison Ave # 24, New York, NY 10016-4001, USA

originalText.text:
Really awful company run by very selfish people.  Avoid this company if possible, nothing good ever comes out of it.  When it comes to making money, you can be living in a moldy, uninhabitable apartment and they will take anything they can.

After hurricane Sandy, my room was flooded floor to ceiling and I lost everything I owned, plus was completely traumatized trying to handle the situation for the next two weeks (I was told after the fact that the apartment is located in Flood Zone A, not sure if it's even legal to have an apartment sub-level in that zone).  I didn't hear from the company until a week later, after I had to live in a freezing cold apartment, with a giant hole in the wall open to the outside, allowing cats/rats/who knows what else to enter freely into my apartment.  Mold began to grow and the staircase down into my room were too soft to support anyone.  After flooding subsided, I received no compensation from the company even though I was told they would offer me something for my loss.  On top of that, I could not live in the apartment for the next 3-4 months.  Despite not being able to live in my apartment, they continued to charge me rent. In the lease it states that if there is damage to the apartment that deems it uninhabitable, a tenant does not have to pay rent.

They also would barge into the apartment, completely unannounced, even though in the lease it states they must give 24 hour notice before coming, and even then would not be allowed to just walk in without our permission.  I was in the shower one day when one of the workers unlocked the door and came in.  As a young woman, this completely traumatized me.  It was completely inappropriate.  They continued to show up unannounced so I had to pay for new locks.

The first 4 months of living in this apartment, I persistently requested that they fix the door, which had been crow barred open from the tenants before us.  The door did not have a dead bolt and could easily have been broken into.

My experience in the city was an awful one because of these terrible, heartless people.  It makes me sad that there are people in this world that can care so little about other people.  Please do yourself a favor and avoid these people.  They will make your life a living hell.

originalText.text: I called and told them there is someone running around in our apartment going crazy and in the parking lot aswell... she said they don't manage our property and Hung up, when the whole time while appling for the apartment I'm in right now I have used this exact same phone number to contact them... very rude
